conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effect of changing light source position
Shadows are formed when an object blocks light; size and shape depend on light source position and distance
Moving light source backward decreases angle of light relative to objects and ground
Decreased angle affects length and size of shadows
Shadows become longer as light source moves backward due to more parallel light rays
Shadow size (width) may increase slightly due to increased angle of incidence
Shadow A (Cage) will become longer and may widen slightly
Shadow B (Box and Pencil) will become longer and may widen slightly
Shadow C (Cone) will become longer and may widen slightly
Shadow D (Cross) will become longer and may widen slightly
All shadows will become longer and may widen slightly when light source moves backward
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become longer and may widen slightly
